title: Bird Flu Sample from Chilean Man Showed Some Signs of Adaptation to Mammals
description: These changes were unlikely to be enough to allow the virus to spread easily among humans, and the health risk to the public remains low, experts said.

title: Russian Attack in Sloviansk, Ukraine, Kills Toddler
description: The 2-year-old boy and at least seven other people were killed after a Russian attack in Sloviansk, Ukrainian officials said. His father is believed to still be trapped in the carnage.

title: In Ireland, Biden Draws on a Family Story Rooted in Hope
description: He may not be a candidate yet, but President Biden delivered a message of optimism to the people of Ireland. It was a possible preview of a campaign to come.

title: Biden Overcome After Seeing Priest Who Gave Last Rites to Son Beau
description: President Biden was in tears after the surprise meeting with the priest, Friar Frank O’Grady, who was given a last-minute security approval to meet with the president.

title: El Chapo’s Sons Face Sweeping New Charges in Fentanyl Indictments
description: The charges, in five related cases, offered a panoramic view of how the deadly drug was created, transported and ultimately sold by the Sinaloa cartel on American streets.

title: Pressure Mounts on China to Offer Debt Relief to Poor Countries Facing Default
description: There was optimism at the spring meetings of the I.M.F. and World Bank that China will make concessions over restructuring its loans.

title: Billy Waugh, 93, ‘Godfather of the Green Berets,’ Is Dead
description: He was a Special Forces soldier during the Vietnam War then worked for the C.I.A., tracking Osama bin Laden in Sudan and fighting in Afghanistan after 9/11.

title: Core of Macron’s Pension Plan Clears Key Legal Test as Protesters Fume
description: A constitutional council reviewing President Emmanuel Macron’s law struck down some sections, but the main part — an increase in the retirement age — was accepted. Anger over the plan remains high.

title: How Much Power Should the Courts Have?
description: In Israel, the United States and other democracies, bitter battles are being waged over the same question.

title: The Great Goat War of Southern France
description: A former Parisian moved to the country, fell in love with goats and let them roam free and multiply. Her winemaking neighbors are not enchanted.

title: This is how Ukraine has survived the war on its power grid.
Russia’s Ambassador Says U.S. Threatened Retaliation Unless Evan Gershkovich Is Released
description: American officials and The Wall Street Journal have vehemently denied the accusation that Evan Gershkovich was engaged in any kind of spying activity.

title: Will Abortion Kill the Filibuster?
description: Courts don’t make laws. Congress does.

title: Ghosts Past and Present Cross Paths as War Comes to Nuclear Wasteland
description: Not everyone evacuated when the Chernobyl nuclear plant melted down in 1986. The few who stayed lived through another calamity when Russian troops marched in.

title: Decades on From Peace, Northern Ireland Schools Are Still Deeply Divided
description: The nation’s school system still sees the country’s pupils starkly divided by their religious backgrounds, years after the Good Friday Agreement brought an end to sectarian strife.

title: Brazil’s President Will Discuss His Peace Proposal With China’s Leader
description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, who is meeting with Xi Jinping, has suggested that Beijing should be part of an effort to hold peace talks. Here is what we’re covering.

title: Learning to Love My Incomprehensible Kiwi Accent
description: It’s surprising how hard it is for New Zealanders to make themselves understood in America.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: An arrest in the document leak in the U.S.

title: Germany Quits Nuclear Power, Ending a Decades-Long Struggle
description: The last three plants in Germany are scheduled to shut down by Saturday, while other European countries are looking to expand nuclear energy.

title: North Korea Says It Launched a Solid-Fuel ICBM, a First
description: If successfully developed, solid-fuel technology would be a significant advance, making the North’s missiles easier to move and harder to target.

title: Jack Teixeira: The Airman Who Wanted to Give Gamers a Real Taste of War
description: The group liked online war games. But then Jack Teixeira, an active-duty airman, began showing them classified documents, members say.
